Thomas Raef wrote:
> I am looking to create a program that will scan through an arc file 
> looking for application/octet. If it finds one it will extract the 
> associated file, scan it with a few different anti-virus programs and 
> then report the result.




>  
> First, what ideas, cautions, etc. can this group provide me before I 
> begin this project.



If you are using java, checkout ARCReader: 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#arcs.  If not, 
the aforementioned citation points you at other alternates.


> Second, has anyone started or completed such a project?
> Third, I've scanned the Internet looking for details of the arc files, 
> but still do not know the exact details of the offsets. For instance, 
> I'll need to know the offset of the application/octet listing.





ARCReader, IIRC, has offset of current record in the record metadata 
available as you are parsing through.

St.Ack




>  
> Any thoughts, comments, criticisms are welcome.
>  
>  
>
